pull.title: clang-tidy: Fix `performance-*move*` warnings in headers
pull.body:
Split from bitcoin/bitcoin#26705 as was requested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26705#issuecomment-1353293405.

To test this PR, consider applying a diff as follows:
```diff
--- a/src/.clang-tidy
+++ b/src/.clang-tidy
@@ -1,16 +1,7 @@
 Checks: '
 -*,
-bugprone-argument-comment,
-bugprone-use-after-move,
-misc-unused-using-decls,
-modernize-use-default-member-init,
-modernize-use-nullptr,
-performance-for-range-copy,
 performance-move-const-arg,
 performance-no-automatic-move,
-performance-unnecessary-copy-initialization,
-readability-redundant-declaration,
-readability-redundant-string-init,
 '
 WarningsAsErrors: '
 bugprone-argument-comment,
@@ -28,4 +19,4 @@ readability-redundant-string-init,
 CheckOptions:
  - key: performance-move-const-arg.CheckTriviallyCopyableMove
    value: false
-HeaderFilterRegex: './qt'
+HeaderFilterRegex: '.'
```

### Conflicts

issue.title: clang-tidy: Fix `modernize-use-default-member-init` in headers and force to check all headers
issue.body:
This PR:
- fixes the only [remained](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26705#issuecomment-1353742082) check in headers, i.e., `modernize-use-default-member-init`
- forces `clang-tidy` check all headers

Closes bitcoin/bitcoin#26703.

issue.title: doc: Properly report optional RPC args
issue.body:
`OMITTED_NAMED_ARG` and `OMITTED` are a confusing burden:

* It puts the burden on developers to pick the right one of the two
* They can be interchanged without introducing a compile failure or other error
* Picking the wrong one is leading to incorrect docs
* They are redundant, because the correct one can already be determined by the surrounding type

Fix all issues by making them an alias of each other; Pick the right one based on the outer type.

events.body: The diff in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26707#issue-1499057294 does not apply

> The diff in [#26707 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26707#issue-1499057294) does not apply

Sorry. It should be a reversal one. Fixed.

comments.body:
fab680ab9061a2dde0c4882caf002b057c1db8c6 has a wider effect as it adds `std::move` as well.

Here, clang-tidy warnings/errors are fixed only. And changes are pretty focused and self-contained.

I'm not sure how to proceed further. Any suggestions?

comments.body: If you rebase directly on fab92a5a5ab45227dbb0aa6d2cf4557b157b17e6, you can avoid changing the commit hash and (potentially) wasting review resources.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -293,11 +293,11 @@ struct RPCResult {
         : RPCResult{cond, type, m_key_name, false, description, inner} {}
comments.body:
> If you rebase directly on [fab92a5](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fab92a5a5ab45227dbb0aa6d2cf4557b157b17e6), you can avoid changing the commit hash and (potentially) wasting review resources.

Done.

TIL. My understanding is that without this patch `tl_node` would not be moved a couple lines below when returning from the function. Making it not `const` fixes this.

If my understanding is correct, ACK.
To be precise, this patch makes a compiler to call a move-constructor instead of a copy-constructor in the `return` statement.
`NodeRef` is `std::shared_ptr<bla>`, so this shouldn't change the compiled binary except for a removed `std::atomic` add and sub.
